title: Did the American War Department in the 1940s compare hate speech against minorities with Nazi propaganda?
subtitle: The short World War II film "Don't be an idiot" cited Nazi propaganda as an example of how hatred was used by minority groups to incite political intolerance.
author: David Emery
vclaim: American War Department film from the 1940s warns Americans that political discourse condemning minorities and foreigners is a precursor to fascist movements such as Nazism.
